metadata.Title: CVE-2021-37576 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.Description:
arch/powerpc/kvm/book3s_rtas.c in the Linux kernel through 5.13.5 on thepowerpc platform allows KVM guest OS users to cause host OS memorycorruption via rtas_args.nargs, aka CID-f62f3c20647e.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-37576` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic-64k - 5.15.0-25.25
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-azure - 5.15.0-1003.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-gcp - 5.15.0-1003.6
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi - 5.15.0-1005.5
linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 5.15.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1001-ibm - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency - 5.15.0-24.24
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-24.24
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-25.25').
linux-azure package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1003.4').

linux-ibm package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1002.2').
linux-lowlatency package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-24.24').
